name: flamemaster

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: build_type
variants.description: The build type to build

variants.name: ipo
variants.description: CMake interprocedural optimization

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: bilin_omega
variants.description: Compile with bilinear interpolationfor collision integrals (omega)

variants.name: combustion
variants.description: Integrate comustion librariesfor kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport

variants.name: fortran_code
variants.description: Compile optional fortran code like dassl, the adiabaticflame temperature module, and a mechanism converter tool

variants.name: scanmannew
variants.description: Compile the new ScanMan

variants.name: dco_chunk_tape
variants.description: Dynamically allocate memory for the dco tape

variants.name: troe
variants.description: FlameMaster mechanism format allows for specifyingan additional parameter. This option disables the use of theparamter which is currently required to run adjoint sensitivity analysis.

variants.name: jl_debug
variants.description: Debug mode during development(Johannes Lotz)

variants.name: flux_bc
variants.description: Specify boundary conditions as velocity [m/s]or massflux in Counterflow (Physical Coord.)

variants.name: full_diffusion
variants.description: Compile with multi-component diffusion

variants.name: intel_prof
variants.description: Enable -prof-gen and -prof-use

variants.name: soot_lib
variants.description: Soot library with moment equation solving

variants.name: newton_perf
variants.description: Compile with time measurement of each Newton step

variants.name: optima
variants.description: Include code for Optima++ features

variants.name: opt_reaction_rates
variants.description: Fast computation of reaction rates.

variants.name: prem_upwind_convec
variants.description: Use upwind scheme for the convective term.

variants.name: sundials_hint
variants.description: No hints on how FlameMaster can install sundials.

variants.name: simd_kinetics
variants.description: WITH SIMD_KINETICS

variants.name: solve_mom_log
variants.description: Solve the soot Moments equation with logarithms

variants.name: solve_with_z
variants.description: Counter flow diffusion flame implementation includesa solution of the mixture fraction equation

variants.name: sundials_lapack
variants.description: Link LAPACK in sundials

variants.name: sundials_no_idas_search
variants.description: Do not search for IDAS (part of sundials).

variants.name: sundials_use_static_lib
variants.description: Use static linking for sundials libraries

variants.name: sundials_diagnos
variants.description: Only for troubleshooting

variants.name: tests
variants.description: Install google-test framework for unit testsand enable units tests.

variants.name: third_party_in_build_dir
variants.description: Compile third party libraries and tools in build diretory

variants.name: local_lewis
variants.description: Write Lewis numbers at every grid point

variants.name: flamemaster_prefix
variants.description: Used to modify the installation directories

variants.name: openmp
variants.description: Build with OpenMP

variants.name: eigen
variants.description: Build with Eigen Integration

variants.name: eglib
variants.description: Build with EG lib

variants.name: sundials
variants.description: with sundials

description:
FlameMaster is an open source C++ program package for 0D combustion and
1D laminar flame calculations. FlameMaster is written by Heinz Pitsch.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.
LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and using this
software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD AOCL-BLIS
license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-4-2-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-eula.html

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.
